jobPostingInfo.title: Navigation Engineer IV
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

JPL’s Mission Design and Navigation Section 392 builds maps and tools for interplanetary navigation, designs efficient routes for spacecraft to reach remote solar system locations, and safely pilots spacecraft to their ultimate destination. We are responsible for: mapping the trajectory design and navigation trade-space to efficiently maximize science return while adhering to operational constraints and mitigating mission risks, science-based modeling, filtering and optimization, balancing trajectory knowledge and control, and quantifying observability and uncertainty.

Responsibilities:

As a member of the multidisciplinary Mission Design and Navigation System Engineering Group (392K) within the Mission Design and Navigation (MDNAV) Section (392), you will direct the development of high-level system engineering and software requirements and coordinate the implementation of the associated technical work in the section. You will guide the formation of system engineering and software policies, computational infrastructure investments and planning, and resource logistics. You will be responsible for mission design and navigation engineering practices, processes, interfaces, and methods. Lead and coordinate the activities of small teams and working groups to conduct these efforts. Perform analyses involving topics ranging from orbital dynamics to software requirements, architecture, and design. You will serve as the primary liaison between the section and various project and program offices, including Multimission Ground Systems and Services Office (MGSS) and the Deep Space Network (DSN), regarding MDNAV system engineering topics. You will serve as the Chair of the section’s Strategic Infrastructure Council, acting as the resolution authority for software and system engineering infrastructure decisions in the section. Represent MDNAV at various Ground Data System (GDS) and MGSS System Engineering meetings, and serve as the navigation software delivery engineer to all projects.

  • Contribute to the design, development, and infusion of new MDNAV concepts, algorithms, and technologies into the section’s activities and operations

  • Work closely with MDNAV leads and software developers to design, plan, and implement complex solutions to meet user community needs and engineering requirements in a multi-mission environment

  • Prepare and/or review significant documents related to MDNAV processes and software such as interface agreements and requirements documents

  • Advise management and present to stakeholders on relevant systems engineering topics which may significantly influence future policies

  • Act as the lead system engineer for the Advanced Multimission Operations System (AMMOS) Mission Design and Navigation program element

  • Act as the MDNAV interface with the DSN as a radiometric data conditioning (RMDC) subsystem systems engineer. Provide customer interface/advocacy role for navigation teams/processes with the DSN (primarily tracking) and be the system analyst for DSN tracking data processing. Present results of project interface testing at DSN reviews.

  • Request/conduct peer reviews for selected DSN, AMMOS, and mission design and navigation topics

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, Astronautical/Aeronautical Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or similar technical discipline with 9 years of related experience, Master’s degree in similar disciplines with 7 years of related experience, or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years of related experience

  • Wide-ranging experience and advanced knowledge in one or more of the following areas: system engineering, mission operations, software engineering, automation, orbital dynamics and analysis.

  • Extensive understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in astrodynamics, navigation operations, or mission design and navigation software development process.

  • Experience with development and delivery of system documentation, such as requirements documents, test plans, and design description documents.

  • Strong knowledge of applicable industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to mission design and navigation and/or software system engineering

  • Ability to interface with stakeholders and communicate ideas clearly

  • Experience working with software developers to architect highly coupled hardware and software solutions in a multi-mission environment

  • Must be a US Citizen or Legal Permanent Resident

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Software development experience in Python

  • Experience with the MONTE software architecture and tools

  • Experience with and advanced knowledge of DSN uplink/downlink/tracking data (UPL/DTT/TDDS) processes and data types including Doppler, Range, and Delta-DOR

  • Familiarity with one or more of the following:

    • DSN physical network; organization; documentation;

    • Software and systems configuration management (CM)

    • MGSS Implementation and Maintenance Task Requirements (MIMTaR)

    • JPL Software Development Requirements (SDR)

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$133,432 - $176,592

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
